result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

15CM395, 16CM88 Defendant, Justin J. Moore in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Barrington heard,   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint in 16CM88 and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Defendant does not have an attorney.  Defendant does want an attorney.  Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Court will have the cases track together.  RD & JT set. Court sets $500 bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.
